trans-unit.source: Manage Azure SQL Databases using the Azure Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Manage Azure SQL Databases using the Azure Management Portal

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use the Azure Management Portal to manage a relational database in the cloud using the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use the Azure Management Portal to manage a relational database in the cloud using the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Managing Azure SQL Databases using the Azure Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Managing Azure SQL Databases using the Azure Management Portal

trans-unit.source: The <link><linkText>Azure management portal[management portal]</linkText><title></title></link> allows you to create, monitor and manage Azure SQL databases and servers.
trans-unit.target: The <link><linkText>Azure management portal[management portal]</linkText><title></title></link> allows you to create, monitor and manage Azure SQL databases and servers.

trans-unit.source: This article will highlight the database operations that can be accomplished using the management portal.
trans-unit.target: This article will highlight the database operations that can be accomplished using the management portal.

trans-unit.source: You can learn more about the other Azure SQL database management tools <link><linkText>here[azuredb management overview]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: You can learn more about the other Azure SQL database management tools <link><linkText>here[azuredb management overview]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: If you are unfamiliar with the Azure management portal, this <link><linkText>video tour provides a quick overview[azure portal tour]</linkText><title></title></link> of its general features and concepts.
trans-unit.target: If you are unfamiliar with the Azure management portal, this <link><linkText>video tour provides a quick overview[azure portal tour]</linkText><title></title></link> of its general features and concepts.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Database Overview</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Database Overview</linkText>

trans-unit.source: 1. Database management actions
trans-unit.target: 1. Database management actions

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Db management actions</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Db management actions</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The Azure management portal provides a set of common database actions accessible at the top of a database blade.
trans-unit.target: The Azure management portal provides a set of common database actions accessible at the top of a database blade.

trans-unit.source: You can restore a database to a previous point in time, open a database in Visual Studio, copy a database to a new server, and export the database to an Azure storage account.
trans-unit.target: You can restore a database to a previous point in time, open a database in Visual Studio, copy a database to a new server, and export the database to an Azure storage account.

trans-unit.source: 2. Database monitoring
trans-unit.target: 2. Database monitoring

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Database monitoring</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Database monitoring</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Azure SQL databases by default feature monitoring charts for Database Throughput Unit (DTU), database size, and connection health.
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL databases by default feature monitoring charts for Database Throughput Unit (DTU), database size, and connection health.

trans-unit.source: These monitoring charts can be customized and extended to additionally chart CPU percentage, Data IO percentage, Deadlocks, Log IO percentage or even the percentage of requests blocked by firewall.
trans-unit.target: These monitoring charts can be customized and extended to additionally chart CPU percentage, Data IO percentage, Deadlocks, Log IO percentage or even the percentage of requests blocked by firewall.

trans-unit.source: More information on how to customize monitoring charts can be found <link><linkText>here[azure part monitoring]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: More information on how to customize monitoring charts can be found <link><linkText>here[azure part monitoring]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, alert rules can be setup to monitor a specified metric and alert a designated administrator and co-administrator when pre-set thresholds are reached.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, alert rules can be setup to monitor a specified metric and alert a designated administrator and co-administrator when pre-set thresholds are reached.

trans-unit.source: More information on how to setup alert rules in the Azure management portal can be found <link><linkText>here[azure part monitoring]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: More information on how to setup alert rules in the Azure management portal can be found <link><linkText>here[azure part monitoring]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: 3. Database security & auditing
trans-unit.target: 3. Database security & auditing

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Database security</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Database security</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Azure SQL databases can be configured to track all database events and write them to an audit log in your Azure storage account.
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL databases can be configured to track all database events and write them to an audit log in your Azure storage account.

trans-unit.source: This feature can help you maintain regulatory compliance, understand database activity, and gain insight into discrepancies that could indicate business concerns or suspected security violations.
trans-unit.target: This feature can help you maintain regulatory compliance, understand database activity, and gain insight into discrepancies that could indicate business concerns or suspected security violations.

trans-unit.source: More information on Azure SQL database auditing can be found <link><linkText>here[azuredb auditing]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: More information on Azure SQL database auditing can be found <link><linkText>here[azuredb auditing]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Azure SQL databases can also be configured to mask sensitive data to non-priviledged users.
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL databases can also be configured to mask sensitive data to non-priviledged users.

trans-unit.source: More information on the Dynamic data masking feature of Azure SQL databases can be found <link><linkText>here[azuredb datamasking]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: More information on the Dynamic data masking feature of Azure SQL databases can be found <link><linkText>here[azuredb datamasking]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: 4. Geo-replication
trans-unit.target: 4. Geo-replication

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Geo-replication</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Geo-replication</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Azure SQL databases can be configured to asynchronously replicate committed transactions to a secondary database.
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL databases can be configured to asynchronously replicate committed transactions to a secondary database.

trans-unit.source: The geo-replication part on the management portal allows you to select the Azure region you would like the secondary database to reside in.
trans-unit.target: The geo-replication part on the management portal allows you to select the Azure region you would like the secondary database to reside in.

trans-unit.source: More information on database geo-replication in Azure can be found <link><linkText>here[database geo-replication]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: More information on database geo-replication in Azure can be found <link><linkText>here[database geo-replication]</linkText><title></title></link>
